channel.title: steps on Codetab
channel.description: Recent content in steps on Codetab

item.title: Workflows Steps - Scoopi Web Scraper - why just scrape when you can scoop
item.description: Steps So far, we explored locators, tasks and dataDef to scrape data from the pages. But, we haven’t explained how Scoopi executes tasks and scrape data. Scoopi is designed to execute tasks as workflow which is normally referred as steps which in turn consists of multiple step. Scoopi ships with two in-built defaults steps jsoupDefault and htmlUnitDefault and they are defined in steps-default.yml which is packaged inside Scoopi distribution jar. We can access the contents of steps-default.

item.title: Steps - Scoopi Web Scraper - CodeTab
item.description: Steps So far, we explored locators to define the pages to scrape, tasks to execute and dataDef to parse data from the pages. But, we haven’t explained how Scoopi executes tasks and scrape data. Scoopi is designed to execute tasks as workflow which is normally referred as steps which in turn consists of multiple step. By default, Scoopi ships with two defaults steps jsoupDefault and htmlUnitDefault and they are defined in steps-default.

Scoopi is designed to execute tasks as workflow which is normally referred as steps which in turn consists of multiple step. Scoopi ships with two in-built defaults steps jsoupDefault and htmlUnitDefault and they are defined in steps-default.yml which is packaged inside Scoopi distribution jar. We can access the contents of steps-default.
